document_data.text: What we call divine, you call arcane — our altars are not so different!
document_data.mainbody:
'''Divine magic''' ('''the Power''') was magic granted from prayer to the gods.<ref name=MoF-pp8-9> Practitioners of divine magic were known as '''divine spellcasters'''.

While divine magic could not function without the [[Weave]],<ref name=FRCS-p54> spellcasters who used divine magic had no ability to manipulate the Weave directly.<ref name=MoF-pp8-9/> [[Cleric]]s, [[druid]]s, [[ranger]]s, [[paladin]]s, and [[blackguard]]s predominantly used this type of magic.<ref name=MoF-pp8-9/> Although in actuality, druids received their power directly from their patron deities, they often thought of this power as coming through nature.<ref name=FRCS-p23> Only deities with a direct tie to nature could provide spell power to druids.<ref name=F&P-p90>

When divine spellcasters used such magical power granted them by the gods, often a tangible feeling of appreciation was felt by the caster, manifesting in different ways depending on the patron of the practitioner.<ref name=MoF-pp8-9/>
